interpGrp.interp: Changes in spelling or orthography. This includes any alterations to how words are written without affecting their meaning, such as standardizing spelling or correcting errors. Also includes adding or removing an alif as a marker of the accusative or at the end of a plural verb. Changes to the diacritics for a final ي or ى can be ignored. If the change affects the meaning or grammatical function of the word (such as the form of a verb), then it is more significant than an orthographic change and should not be in this category.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single minor word or part of a word. A minor word means a conjunction, pronoun, demonstrative pronoun (e.g. ذلك), pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, interrogative particle (such as 'ما') or other particle (such as 'قد'). This includes the expansion or contraction of a word and changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice, including changes to person or number and transformations between participle and verb. If the root word is the same but the number changes, then it falls in this category. It can still be in this category if the change affects the meaning substantially, so long as it is only affecting the part of speech described here or it does not change the root of the word. If there are changes to multiple words between readings (even if they are minor), then it should not be in this category but it is under 'Multiple_Word_Changes'. If there are multiple minor changes to a single word, then it can still be a Single_Minor_Word_Change.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single word that is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, or particle (such as 'قد'). It is only a major word change if the root of the word is different. If a word is changed to a different form of the same root, then it is a Single_Minor_Word_Change. If the two readings are identical except for a difference in a single major word, then it is in this category (even if the readings otherwise contain multiple words).

Changes across more than one word. Words can be major or minor. Even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in this category. If more than one word is added or omitted, then it is in this category.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه

relation.desc: Several words are added.
More than one word is changed because by transposing اليهود it also affects the ل preposition.

Multiple words are added to the text, including the phrase "قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود", which involves several words being introduced where previously there was no text. This matches the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which states that if multiple words are added or changed, it falls into this category.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود

Multiple words are added to the text, including the phrase "قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود", which involves more than one word being introduced. This matches the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which states that if multiple words are added or changed, it falls into this category. The example set provides similar instances like "OMIT → ابراهيم فلم يفعل هذا" where multiple words are added.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

[The change involves the omission of the final alif in اتوا, which is a spelling variation that does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is consistent with the examples provided in the Orthography category, such as "قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود → قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود" which specifically demonstrates the omission of the final alif in a verb.]
c.f. قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
Several words are added.

The entire phrase فكلمهم ايضا يسوع is a major word change because it involves the omission of a complete clause containing multiple words, but since the change involves a single clause (which can be considered a single syntactic unit), it falls under Single_Major_Word_Change. This is similar to other examples in the provided list such as "وقال → OMIT" or "تقدروا → OMIT" where a single major word or clause is completely omitted.
c.f. فكلمهم ايضا يسوع ➞ OMIT
A single major word is added.
Two words are added.

[The change involves adding a new word (صوته) before the existing word وقال, which means more than one word has been modified. Even though the added word is relatively short, the presence of an additional word places this variation in the Multiple_Word_Changes category, as per the definition that states "Changes across more than one word" and "Even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in this category".]
c.f. وقال ➞ صوته وقال
The pronoun هو is added which is a minor word.

[The change is only in the orthography of the preposition في, where the final ي is replaced with ى, which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is a standard orthographic variation in Arabic script, similar to other examples provided like changes in spelling or diacritical marks.]
c.f. يمشي في الظلمه الي ➞ يمشي فى الظلمه
The preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
The preposition ل is added to الدهر.
[The major words الابد and الدهر have different roots, and the pronominal suffix معه is changed to له, which involves a change to a single major word.]
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون له

Multiple words are changed: the noun الابد is changed to الدهر (a major word change), the verb تكون is changed to يكون (a minor word change), and the preposition معه is changed to له (a minor word change).
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

[The major word الابد is changed to الدهر, which involves a change in the root word. This is not an orthographic change because the meaning is substantively different, and it involves changing a single major word (noun) rather than a minor word or multiple words.]
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

Multiple words are changed: the major word الابد is replaced with the major word للدهر, and the preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to the preposition (with pronominal suffix) له. This matches the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which occurs when more than one word is altered, even if the changes are minor.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The verb form is changed from تكون to يكون, which involves a modification in verb form while maintaining the same root. This falls under the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, which includes "changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice, including changes to person or number". The example in the provided list "تكونوا احرار → تكونون احرار" is analogous to this variation.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون له ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The change involves a modification of the verb form from يكون to تكون and a substitution of the preposition/pronominal suffix from له to معه. This falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category because it involves changes to minor words (verb form and preposition/pronominal suffix) without changing the root of the words. This is similar to the example "الدهر بل تكون له → الدهر بل تكون معه" provided in the original list of examples, where a preposition with pronominal suffix is changed.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

The change involves adding the preposition ل at the beginning of الدهر, which is a minor word change. The verb form remains the same (يكون/تكون), and the overall grammatical structure is preserved. This is similar to the example "اجاب يسوع فقال → اجاب يسوع فقال لهم" where a preposition is added, which falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

[The change involves replacing the preposition معه with the preposition له, which are both minor words. The core meaning and structure of the sentence remain the same, and only a minor word (preposition with pronominal suffix) is substituted, which matches the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change as demonstrated in the earlier example: "الدهر بل تكون له → الدهر بل تكون معه".]
c.f. الدهر بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

[The major word نور is added to the existing text, changing the meaning substantially. This is a change to a single word that is not a minor particle or conjunction, and the added word نور represents a different root from الحياه, making it a significant lexical change.]
c.f. الحياه ➞ نور الحياه

[The preposition الي is a minor word, and its addition falls under the category of Single_Minor_Word_Change, which includes the addition of prepositions, particles, and other minor words. This is similar to other examples in the provided list where prepositions or other minor words are added or changed.]
c.f. OMIT ➞ الي
The pronoun انت is added and an alif is added to تشهد.
A ب preposition is add to حق.
The orthographic change is made to يسوع making it ايسوع and the ف conjunction is changed to a و.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع.
The verb اجاب is added and the phrase فقال لهم is moved to the end. The conjunction ف is changed to a و.

[The change is simply a spelling variation of يسوع to ايسوع, which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is consistent with the orthography category examples such as يسوع → ايسوع, where the spelling is modified without changing the word's semantic content.]
c.f. اجاب يسوع فقال لهم ➞ فقال لهم ايسوع

[The spelling of ايسوع is changed to يسوع, which is a change in spelling without affecting the meaning of the word. This is consistent with the definition of orthographic changes, such as the examples of changing يسوع to ايسوع or vice versa provided in the earlier examples.]
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب يسوع وقال لهم

[The conjunction و is changed to ف, which is a minor word change. This is similar to the example "فقالوا → وقالوا" in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category, but in this case the change is from و to ف.]
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

[Multiple words are changed: the verb فقال is replaced with اجاب, and the verb and its object are transposed. This involves more than one word being modified, which falls under the Multiple_Word_Changes category as per the provided definition. Similar to the example "اجاب يسوع وقال لهم" in the Multiple_Word_Changes category, this variation involves adding a verb and changing the word order.]
c.f. فقال لهم ايسوع ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

[The change is only in the spelling of يسوع by adding an initial alif, which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is consistent with the examples of orthographic changes like يسوع → ايسوع or اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم → اجاب يسوع فقال لهم, which involve simple spelling variations.]
c.f. اجاب يسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم
The conjunction و is added.
The preposition هي is added.

من اين انا والي اين اذهب واما انتم

اين اتيت ولا الي اين اذهب

relation.desc: Multiple words are changed.

The change involves removing the conjunction و and the minor word انما, which are both considered minor words according to the definition. The root word انتم remains unchanged, and only minor words are being modified, which aligns with the Single_Minor_Word_Change category as demonstrated in similar examples like ان → OMIT or اما انتم فتفعلون → واما انتم فتفعلون.
c.f. وانتم انما ➞ انتم
The major word تقظون is omitted.

The entire phrase ايما تقضون is a major word (not a minor particle or conjunction) and it is being completely omitted from the text. This matches the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change, which includes omission of a single word with a significant meaning. Similar to examples like "تقدروا → OMIT" or "كثيرين → OMIT" in the provided examples, where a single major word is removed.
c.f. ايما تقضون ➞ OMIT
The pronoun انتم is added.

The change is to the form of the verb تقضون to تقضوا, which involves a modification to the verb's form (person or number). This falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category because the root of the word remains the same, and the change is to the verb's form, which is explicitly described in the category definition as including "changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice, including changes to person or number".
c.f. OMIT ➞ تقضوا
The conjunction و is added.

[The change involves adding the conjunction و to the start of the phrase, which is a minor word change. This is similar to the example "اما الابن → واما الابن" where the conjunction و is added. The root words remain the same, and only a minor word (the conjunction) is modified.]
c.f. اما انا ➞ وانا

[The change involves removing the minor word اما, which is a conjunction/particle, and keeping the rest of the text intact. This matches the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, which allows for addition, omission, or substitution of minor words like conjunctions. Similar examples in the provided list include changes like "وان → ان" and "اما انتم فتفعلون → واما انتم فتفعلون", where conjunctions are added or removed.]
c.f. واما انا ➞ وانا
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two changes occur. The conjunction ف is added at the start and the orthographic change occurs by addings an alif of nasb to احد.
Diacritics are added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start.

The change involves adding the conjunction ف at the start of the phrase and adding the alif of nasb to احد, which are both minor word modifications. The first change is adding a conjunction (a minor word), and the second change is an orthographic modification to the end of a word that does not fundamentally change its meaning. This matches the example in the provided list: "ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا [The conjunction ف is added at the start.]"
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احدا

[The conjunction ف is added at the start of the phrase, which falls under the definition of a minor word change. This is similar to the example "ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا" in the provided examples, where a conjunction is added at the start of the phrase.]
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احد

[The conjunction ف is added at the start of the phrase, which is a minor word change. This is similar to the example "ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا" in the provided examples, which falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category.]
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احدا

The change involves adding the conjunction ف at the start of the phrase and removing the alif of nasb from احدا, which are both minor word modifications. The example set includes similar cases like "ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا" where a conjunction is added, and the changes do not affect the root meaning of the words.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

[The change is simply the removal of the final alif of nasb (accusative marker) on احدا, which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is consistent with the definition of orthographic changes, specifically the example "ليس ادين احدا → ليس ادين احد" in the provided examples.]
c.f. فليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

[The change is simply the removal of the diacritical mark (tanwin/nunation) at the end of احد, which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is consistent with the definition of orthographic changes that involve adding or removing diacritics without changing the word's meaning.]
c.f. فليس ادين احدًا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change involves multiple words: the addition of the pronoun هو and the modification of the preposition لان, which affects more than one word in the text. This falls under the Multiple_Word_Changes category as defined in the examples, such as cases where two or more words are altered simultaneously.
c.f. لاني ➞ هو لان
Changes occur to two words.
The form of لست is changed to ليست.
The form of ليست is changed to ليس.

The change is from the verb لست to ليس, which involves a modification of the verb form while maintaining the same root and meaning. This is similar to the example in the provided list: "ليست واحدى → ليس وحدي", where the form of the verb is changed. The change affects the verb's form but does not alter the fundamental meaning or use a different root word.
c.f. لست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي

The form of the verb ليست is changed to ليس, which involves a modification to the verb form. This falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category as it changes the verb's tense/form while keeping the same root, and is similar to the example provided in the instructions: "ليست واحدى → ليس وحدي [The form of ليست is changed to ليس.]"
c.f. ليست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي
The pronoun انا is added.
A pronominal suffix is added.
A و conjunction is omitted and pronominal suffix is added to a single word.

c.f. ولكني ➞ لكنى

c.f. حق ➞ OMIT

c.f. حق ➞ حق هي

c.f. انا ➞ وانا

c.f. نفسى ➞ OMIT

c.f. لي ذلك ➞ لي وهو

c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان ساعه لم

c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان الساعه لم

This is similar to the example "تكن بلغت → تكن اتت" in the provided examples, which was also categorized as a Single_Major_Word_Change.]

relation.desc: Multiple wrds are added.
The final alif in اتوا is omitted.
Multiple wrds are added.

[Multiple words are changed: the verb اذهب is changed to انطلق (a major word change), the verb form تطلبوني is changed to تطلبونى (a minor word change), and the preposition وفي is changed to ولا (a minor word change).]
c.f. اذهب وتطلبوني وفي ➞ انطلق وتطلبونى ولا

The conjunction و is removed, which falls under the definition of a minor word change. This is similar to other examples in the provided list where a conjunction is added or removed, such as "وان → ان" or "فقالوا → وقالوا", which are classified as Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. وبخطاياكم ➞ خطاياكم

This matches the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which occurs when changes span more than one word, even if the individual changes might be minor or major.
c.f. خطاياكم ➞ تجدونى وباثمكم

The form of the verb تموتون is changed to تموتوا, which involves a change in the verb's ending (person/number) but maintains the same root. This is consistent with the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, which includes modifications in verb form, such as changes to person or number, while keeping the root word the same. This is similar to the example in the provided list: "تكونوا احرار → تكونون احرار" where the verb form is modified.
c.f. تموتون وحيث ➞ تموتوا وحيث
The pronoun (with conjunction) فانتم is added.
[The root of the verb changes from ن-ط-ل-ق (to set out/depart) to ذ-ه-ب (to go), which represents a change in the major word with a different root, not just a modification of the same root's form.]
c.f. انطلق انا ➞ اذهب انا

[The change involves adding multiple words: the verb انطلق replaces اذهب, and the pronoun (with conjunction) فانتم is added, which affects more than one word in the text. This matches the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which includes changes across more than one word, even if the individual changes might be minor.]
c.f. اذهب انا ➞ انطلق انا فانتم
The form of تاتون is changed to تاتوا.

[Multiple words are changed: the negative particle ليس is changed to لا, and the verb تاتون is changed to تجون, which involves a change in the root of the verb. Since more than one word is modified, this falls under the Multiple_Word_Changes category.]
c.f. ليس تقدرون تاتون ➞ لا تقدرون تجون

[The form of the verb تقدرو is changed to تقدرون, which involves a modification to the verb's form (person/number) while maintaining the same root. relation.desc: The conjunction ف is changed to و.

[The root of the word has changed from the verb قول (to say) to the adjective صادق (truthful). This is a significant change involving a different root word, which matches the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change where the root of the word is different. Similar to examples like تسمعون كلامي → تسمعون قولي or بيت الكنز → بيت القربان, this represents a substitution of one major word with another of a different root.]
c.f. اقول الحق ➞ صادق
The conjunction ف is changed to و.

The pronominal suffix له is a minor word, and its omission falls under the category of Single_Minor_Word_Change, which includes additions, omissions, or substitutions to single minor words such as pronouns, pronominal suffixes, and other particles. This is consistent with the example e.g. ان → OMIT [The minor word ان is omitted.] in the provided list of Single_Minor_Word_Change examples.
c.f. له ➞ OMIT
The word نعما was changed to حق.

The word نقول is a major word (verb) that is being completely omitted, which matches the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change where a single word is removed. This is similar to other examples in the provided list such as "تقدروا → OMIT" or "اشهد → OMIT" where a single major word is omitted.
c.f. نقول ➞ OMIT

[The phrase ما نقول is a minor word/phrase consisting of the interrogative particle ما and the verb نقول, which is a minor change involving a single phrase. This matches the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, which allows for omission of a minor word or phrase, similar to other examples like ان → OMIT in the provided examples.]
c.f. ما نقول ➞ OMIT
One major word is added.

[The change involves adding the definite article ال, which is a minor word according to the definition. The root word شيطان remains the same, and the addition of the definite article is a minor modification that does not fundamentally alter the meaning or root of the word.]
c.f. شيطان ➞ الشيطان

[The change involves adding the conjunction و to the start of the phrase, which is a minor word change. This matches the example of "وان → ان" or "اما انتم فتفعلون → واما انتم فتفعلون" where a conjunction is added or removed, which falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category.]
c.f. فانت سامري ➞ وانت سامري
Multiple words are added.

[Multiple words are added: اجاب and ايسوع are new words that did not exist in the original reading. This matches the definition that if more than one word is added, it falls under the Multiple_Word_Changes category. This is similar to the example "فقال → اجاب يسوع وقال" in the provided examples, which was also categorized as Multiple_Word_Changes.]
c.f. فقال ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال
The preposition (with suffix) لهم is added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start and the major word شيطان is omitted.

Multiple words are changed: the conjunction اما is replaced with ان, and the word order of شيطان and ليس is altered, which affects the syntax of the phrase. This matches the definition that even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, it falls under the Multiple_Word_Changes category.
c.f. اما شيطان فليس في ➞ ان شيطان ليس فى

The article ال is added to شيطان, which is a minor word change involving the definite article. This is similar to the example "اللاه → الله" where an article is added or removed. The root word remains the same, and only a minor grammatical modification is made.
c.f. اما شيطان فليس في ➞ اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ
[The preposition في is omitted, which is a minor word change. The rest of the text remains the same, and the preposition is a minor word as defined in the category description.]
c.f. اما شيطان فليس في ➞ اما شيطان فليس

[Multiple changes have occurred: the conjunction ف is added at the start, the minor word ان is changed to اما, and the preposition فى is omitted. This matches the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which includes changes across more than one word, even if the individual changes are minor.]
c.f. ان شيطان ليس فى ➞ اما شيطان فليس

[The change involves multiple modifications: the conjunction ف is added at the start, the major word انا is replaced with الشيطان, which involves changing more than one word. This matches the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes where two or more words are altered, even if some changes are minor and some are major.]
c.f. فاما انا فليس في ➞ اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ

[Multiple words are changed: the article الشيطان is changed to شيطان (a major word change), and the preposition في is omitted, which involves changes to more than one word. This matches the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which includes any changes across more than one word, even if some of those changes are minor.]
c.f. اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ ➞ اما شيطان فليس
The major word شيطان is added.
The major word التمس is omitted.

[The root of the verb changes from l-m-s (التمس) to t-l-b (اطلب), which represents a change in the fundamental meaning of the word, not just its form or grammatical function. This matches the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change where the root of the word is different.]
c.f. التمس ➞ اطلب

The verb اطلب is a major word with its own root, and its complete omission represents a significant change that affects the meaning of the sentence. This matches the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change, which includes omitting a single major word, as seen in the example "تقدروا → OMIT" in the provided sample variants.
c.f. اطلب ➞ OMIT
The preposition هو was added.

[The change is a simple orthographic modification involving the removal of the pronoun هو, which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the phrase. This is similar to other orthographic examples like changing spelling or adding/removing an alif, where the core meaning remains unchanged.]
c.f. هو الذي ➞ الذى

[The words هو and الذي are both minor words (a pronoun and a relative pronoun), and their order is simply transposed without changing the meaning or root of either word. This is similar to other examples in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category where word order is modified.]
c.f. هو الذي ➞ الذي هو

The word ان is a minor word (an interrogative or conditional particle), and its omission falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category, as demonstrated by the example in the provided list: "ان → OMIT [The minor word ان is omitted]".
c.f. ان ➞ OMIT

[The word الابد is changed to الدهر, which involves a change in the root word. This is a substitution of a single major word, as the two words have different roots and meanings, and the rest of the text remains unchanged.]
c.f. الى الابد ➞ الى الدهر
